page.title: 19FARMING AND HEDGES
page.content: From the East Anglian Daily Times 6/6/85 A Somersham farmer claims he is being orced to bulldoze 400 yds of hedge growth for economical reasons.But villagers say he's out to destroy footpaths on his land.Someone said the hedge will be disapearing in a few days She said that sometimes up to 80 people from Somersham and Flowton walked the paths,and that once the hedge alongside the path disapeared,"It's going to be bsolute hell trying to walk up here" Another resident who declined to be named said she was"horrifed" when she saw the trees had been cut down."It's only a small hedge but there is the most fabulous bank of cowslips in spring. The farmer said the hedge had to go beause of sheer economics.
